page.title: 05Produce Shows, Warbleton
page.content: Warbleton and District Horticultural and Poultry Society which was formed in 1934 is still a flourishing group although the poultry section was not revived after its wartime ban. The Summer Show, a highlight in the village year, is now held on the village green on the last Saturday of July. A hired marquee is used to stage the classes of vegetables, flowers, eggs, cookery and handicrafts for which many silver cups are awarded. Childrens classes include cookery, art handicrafts and handwriting. There are also competitions for the best kept pets. Displaying and judging takes place in the morning, with the general public arriving at 2pm to admire the displays, visit the many side shows and stalls or enjoy a cup of tea and a homemade cake. Since 1977 a smaller indoor April Spring show has been held
